mcq.statement: What does the idiom 'have no business doing something' imply?

options.a: To be very skilled at a particular task
options.b: To have no right or reason to do something
options.c: To be involved in a commercial venture
options.d: To be busy with various tasks

mcq.one_liner: The idiom 'have no business doing something' means to have no right or justification to engage in a particular action.
